content: When traversing the MIR CFG and using visitor trait's visit_statement, is there any convenient way to find out which MIR body contains this statement?
The MIR body on which you ran the visitor contains it. MIR vistors don't recurse into callees.
do we have any example about inter-procedural analysis on MIR?
We have exactly one inter-procedural optimization (inlining) and it gives some trouble as we need to prevent query cycles in case of mutually recursive functions.
just analysis, if there are some inter-procedural optimization that would be better
The MIR inliner can be found at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/inline.rs
